process.name: Test Nested Collections
process.narrative: The process will test everything to do with nested collections.

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection to act upon

exception.detail: "The processed nested collection is not as expected"

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection to act upon

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection to act upon

output.name: Count
output.narrative: The number of columns counted in the collection

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection to act upon

output.name: Count
output.narrative: The number of rows counted in the collection

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection to act upon

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection to act upon

exception.detail: "The counted columns were incorrect. Expected: " & [Expected Columns] & "; Found: " & [Column Count]
"The counted rows were incorrect; Expected: " & [Expected Rows] & "; Found: " & [Row Count]
"The wrong ammount of rows were counted, it would seem that the row was removed as requested. Expected: " & [Expected Rows] & " row(s); Found: " & [Row Count] & " row(s)."
"The wrong amount of rows were counts, it would seem the new row wasn't added. Expected count of " & [Expected Rows] & "; Found: " & [Row Count]

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection to act upon

output.name: Count
output.narrative: The number of rows counted in the collection

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection to act upon

output.name: Count
output.narrative: The number of rows counted in the collection

exception.detail: "The collection entered the loop. That means not all of the rows were deleted. Found: " & [Count] & " row(s)"

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection to act upon

input.name: Start Row
input.narrative: The index of the first row to copy. The index is from 0 to N-1 (where N is the total number of rows in the collection).

input.name: End Row
input.narrative: The index of the last row to copy. The index is from 0 to N-1 (where N is the total number of rows in the collection).

output.name: Result
output.narrative: A collection which contains the rows copied from the input collection

exception.detail: "The data was wrong, it would seem the wrong row was copied. Expected name: '" & [Expected Name] & "'; Found name: '" & [Copied Rows.Name] & "'"
"The row is populated, it would seem like the new row was not selected like it should have been."

decision.expression: [Teams.People.Name] = "Matt" AND [Teams.People.Date] = MakeDate(9, 9, 1994) AND [Teams.People.Time] = MakeTime(10, 11, 12) AND [Teams.People.IsGood] = False

exception.detail: "The data that you just put in to the new row was incorrect. Expected: " & "'Matt', '" & MakeDate(9,9,1994) & "', '" & MakeTime(10,11,12) & "', 'False'; Found: " & "'" & [Teams.People.Name] & "', '" & [Teams.People.Date] & "', '" & [Teams.People.Time] & "', '" & [Teams.People.IsGood] & "'. "

decision.expression: [Teams.People.Name] = "Jane" AND [Teams.People.Date] = MakeDate(21, 9, 1967) AND [Teams.People.Time] = MakeTime(1, 2, 3) AND [Teams.People.IsGood] = True

exception.detail: "The data that you just put in to the new row was incorrect. Expected: " & "'Jane', '" & MakeDate(21, 9, 1967) & "', '" & MakeTime(1,2,3) & "', 'True'; Found: " & "'" & [Teams.People.Name] & "', '" & [Teams.People.Date] & "', '" & [Teams.People.Time] & "', '" & [Teams.People.IsGood] & "'. "

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection to act upon

exception.detail: "A single row collection shouldn't be able to ""Add Row"""

"This is not the error message you are looking for. The ""Add Row"" action failed, but not for the reason we expected. Expected: '" & [Expected Single Row Error] & "', but found: '" & [Exception] & "'"

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection to act upon

output.name: Count
output.narrative: The number of rows counted in the collection

exception.detail: "The ""Single Row Collection"" seems to have a row count other than 1 - specifically, it has " & [Row Count] & " rows"

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection to act upon

input.name: Start Row
input.narrative: The index of the first row to copy. The index is from 0 to N-1 (where N is the total number of rows in the collection).

input.name: End Row
input.narrative: The index of the last row to copy. The index is from 0 to N-1 (where N is the total number of rows in the collection).

output.name: Result
output.narrative: A collection which contains the rows copied from the input collection

exception.detail: "The wrong data seems to have been copied. Expected: 'Matt'; Found: '" & [Copied Rows.Name] & "'"

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection to act upon

exception.detail: "A single row collection shouln't be able to ""Remove Row"""

"This is not the error message you are looking for. The ""Remove Row"" action failed, but not for the reason we expected. Expected: '" & [Expected Single Row Error] & "', but found: '" & [Exception] & "'"

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection to act upon

exception.detail: "A single row collection shouln't be able to ""Remove All Rows"""

"This is not the error message you are looking for. The ""Remove All Rows"" action failed, but not for the reason we expected. Expected: '" & [Expected Single Row Error] & "', but found: '" & [Exception] & "'"
"The row didn't contain the expected data. Expected 'Matt'; Found: '" & [Single Row Col.Person.Name] & "'"
"The row didn't contain the expected data. Expected: 'Joe'; Found: '" & [Single Row Col.Person.Name] & "'"

stage.name: Expected Single Row Error
stage.initialvalue: Cannot act on a single row collection

exception.detail: "Unexpected count found in Copy Row section: " & [Count]
